api package¶

Subpackages¶

Submodules¶

api.accountviews module¶

account_checkexistence(self, request, *args, **kwargs)¶

Checks whether an account with the specified email exists in the database or not.

Parameters

request (Request) – Contains the email of the desired Account in the database.

Returns

HTTP_200_OK along with the user_id if it exists or HTTP_400_BAD_REQEST if the request data does not contain an email field.

Return type

Reponse

account_create(self, request, *args, **kwargs)¶

Creates a new Account and saves it in the database.

Parameters

request (Request) – An object containing data needed to create a new Account.

Returns

An HTTP response indicating that the new Account was successfully saved in the database or that there was an error and the Account object was not created.

Return type

Reponse

account_data(self, request, *args, **kwargs)¶

Returns the bids and swipes that a user is associated with to display in the frontend

Parameters

request (Request) – contains user_id

Returns

{“Pending”: [], “Accepted”: [] }, “Swipes”: {“Available”: [], “Sold”: [] }}

Return type

a JSON whose format is r = {“Bids”

account_shouldupdatelocation(self, request, *args, **kwargs)¶

Determines whether the location on an object should be updated.

Parameters

request (Request) – The Request containing the user_id of the user to whom the account belongs.

Returns

An HTTP Response that denotes an error in finding the account or if the location should be updated.

Return type

Response

account_update(self, request, *args, **kwargs)¶

Updates the information in an existing Account within the database.

Parameters

request (Request) – An object containing the new data to be placed into the Account object.

Returns

An HTTP response that indicates whether the Account was successfully updated or if there was an error.

Return type

Response

account_updatelocation(self, request, *args, **kwargs)¶

Updates the location associated with an account.

Parameters

request (Request) – The HTTP Request containing the user_id and lat/lng field that needs to be updated.

Returns

The reponse denoting success or failure of the update.

Return type

Reponse

bid_filter(bids, accepted)¶

Given a list of Bid or Swipe objects, return a list with the serialized JSON Objects

Parameters

- A list of Bid objects (bids) –

Returns

serialized_bids - list of Bid objects in JSON form

class Account(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: api.models.User

Account object. Each user has an account. Inherits from User.

cur_loc¶

Accessor to the related object on the forward side of a many-to-one or one-to-one (via ForwardOneToOneDescriptor subclass) relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Child.parent is a ForwardManyToOneDescriptor instance.

cur_loc_id¶

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

In the example:

class Restaurant(Model):
    place = OneToOneField(Place, related_name='restaurant')

Restaurant.place is a ForwardOneToOneDescriptor instance.

class Bid(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: django.db.models.base.Model

Bid object. The criteria a buyer specifies for a swipe such that he/she is willing to purchase the swipe.

class DiningHall(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: api.models.Location

DiningHall object. Used as filtering criteria for buyers and sellers to specify where they want to use / sell their Swipes at. Inherits from Location.

exception DoesNotExist¶

Bases: api.models.DoesNotExist

exception MultipleObjectsReturned¶

Bases: api.models.MultipleObjectsReturned

bid_set¶

Accessor to the related objects manager on the reverse side of a many-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Parent.children is a ReverseManyToOneDescriptor instance.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

class Location(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: django.db.models.base.Model

Location object. Various locations are stored in this table, including those for dining halls, home locations of users, and (later) current locations of sellers

api.swipeviews module¶

create_and_pair(self, request, *args, **kwargs)¶
get_best_pairing(self, request, *args, **kwargs)¶

Finds all bids that match the specified swipe criteria and pairs them.

Parameters

  • hall_id (string) – The dining hall identifier.

  • time_intervals (Datatime, optional) – The desired time intervals. Defaults to None.

  • desired_price (Float, optional) – The desired price. Defaults to None.

  • pair_type –

Returns

The paired Bid or Swipe depending on which endpoint originated the request.

Return type

Bid/Swipe

get_hall_stats(self, request, *args, **kwargs)¶

Finds swipes and bids for a given hall at a given time.

Parameters

request (Request) – Object that contains the user specified hall_id and time.

Returns

HTML response containing the swipe counts, bid counts, lowest ask and highest bid meeting the user

specified criteria, or it returns an error HTML response.

Return type

Reponse

get_highest_bid(bid_candidates, start, end)¶

Function for getting the highest big out of a list of bids in a desired time interval.

Parameters

  • bid_candidates (list) – The list of bids

  • start (int) – The start of the desired time interval

  • end (int) – The end of the desired time interval

Returns

The highest bid price.

Return type

float

get_lowest_swipe(swipe_candidates, start, end)¶

Function for getting the lowest swipe in a given time range.

Parameters

  • swipe_candidates (list) – The swipes

  • start (int) – The start of the desired time interval

  • end (int) – The end of the desired time interval

Returns

The lowest price out of all swipes

Return type

float

get_swipes(self, request, *args, **kwargs)¶

Return swipe data for each dining hall; used to populate main page

Parameters

request (Request) – does’t need inputs

Returns

dining halls with the lowest swipe available and total number of swipes {“Hall”: {“nBids”: 1, “nSwipes”: 1, “times”: {“start”: 17, “end”: 20}, “lowest_ask”: 5}}

Return type

JSON

lowestswipe_highestbid_info(self, request, *args, **kwargs)¶

Get the lowest swipe price and highest bid price in a time interval

Parameters

  • hall_id (string) – The DiningHall identifier.

  • start (int) – start of the time interval

  • end (int) – end of the time interval

Returns

(string: lowest swipe price),”high” : (string: highest bid price)}

Return type

{“low”
